{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Data Analyst",
  "description": "Blume Distribution Limited plays a crucial role in promoting and distributing the wide range of products manufactured by Sonia Foods Industries Limited. With a strong presence in the Nigerian market, Sonia Foods Industries Limited has established itself as a trusted and renowned brand known for its high-quality tomato-based food and beverages.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Psition: Data Analyst
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for collecting, organizing, and analyzing data to support strategic business decisions.
	This role requires expertise in statistical analysis, data visualization, and the ability to communicate insights effectively to stakeholders.


Key Responsibilities
Data Collection and Management:


	Gather, clean, and organize data from various sources, including databases, spreadsheets, and external platforms.
	Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data sets by performing quality checks.


Analysis and Reporting:


	Conduct detailed data analyses to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
	Develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations to present findings in an understandable and meaningful way.


Collaboration:


	Work with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and deliver tailored insights.
	Provide recommendations to enhance business performance based on data analysis.


Statistical Analysis:


	Use statistical tools to interpret data, identify correlations, and predict outcomes.
	Perform A/B testing and other data experiments to evaluate strategies and initiatives.


Process Improvement:


	Develop and improve data analysis processes, ensuring scalability and efficiency.
	Automate repetitive data tasks using tools like Python, R, or SQL scripts.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Accuracy of data analysis and reporting.
	Timeliness in delivering insights and recommendations.
	Impact of recommendations on business outcomes.


Qualifications and Skills
Education:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field. A master&rsquo;s degree is a plus.


Experience:


	Minimum 3-6 years of experience in a data analysis or similar role.
	Proven track record of turning raw data into actionable business insights.


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in SQL for database querying.
	Experience with data analysis tools such as Excel, Python, R, or SAS.
	Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
	Understanding of statistical analysis and predictive modeling.


Soft Skills:


	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent communication and presentation abilities.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.


Salary
N250,000 - N350,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to:&nbsp;careers@blumedistribution.com&nbsp;CC:&nbsp;Oluchi.Sunday@blumedistribution.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-05",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Blume Distribution Limited"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    }

}



Data Analyst Job at Blume Distribution Limited




        
    

        
        Blume Distribution Limited plays a crucial role in promoting and distributing the wide range of products manufactured by Sonia Foods Industries Limited. With a strong presence in the Nigerian market, Sonia Foods Industries Limited has established itself as a trusted and renowned brand known for its high-quality tomato-based food and beverages.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Psition: Data Analyst
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for collecting, organizing, and analyzing data to support strategic business decisions.
	This role requires expertise in statistical analysis, data visualization, and the ability to communicate insights effectively to stakeholders.


Key Responsibilities
Data Collection and Management:


	Gather, clean, and organize data from various sources, including databases, spreadsheets, and external platforms.
	Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data sets by performing quality checks.


Analysis and Reporting:


	Conduct detailed data analyses to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
	Develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations to present findings in an understandable and meaningful way.


Collaboration:


	Work with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and deliver tailored insights.
	Provide recommendations to enhance business performance based on data analysis.


Statistical Analysis:


	Use statistical tools to interpret data, identify correlations, and predict outcomes.
	Perform A/B testing and other data experiments to evaluate strategies and initiatives.


Process Improvement:


	Develop and improve data analysis processes, ensuring scalability and efficiency.
	Automate repetitive data tasks using tools like Python, R, or SQL scripts.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Accuracy of data analysis and reporting.
	Timeliness in delivering insights and recommendations.
	Impact of recommendations on business outcomes.


Qualifications and Skills
Education:


	Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field. A master’s degree is a plus.


Experience:


	Minimum 3-6 years of experience in a data analysis or similar role.
	Proven track record of turning raw data into actionable business insights.


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in SQL for database querying.
	Experience with data analysis tools such as Excel, Python, R, or SAS.
	Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
	Understanding of statistical analysis and predictive modeling.


Soft Skills:


	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent communication and presentation abilities.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.


Salary
N250,000 - N350,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: careers@blumedistribution.com CC: Oluchi.Sunday@blumedistribution.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Vacancies at Eat 'N' Go Limited
content:
Eat 'N' Go Limited is a restaurant group on a mission to become the premier food operator in Africa. So far, our growing family consists of three international brands, Domino's Pizza, Cold Stone Creamery & Pinkberry.

Eat ‘N’ Go limited officially started operation in August 2012 with the premier store at 4, Saka Tinubu Victoria Island, Lagos. Today, Eat N' Go has about 100 stores (outlet) across Nigeria and still growing.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Administrative Manager

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Job Type: Full Time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Administrative Manager is responsible for overseeing the administrative coordination, compliance, and reporting functions of the maintenance department.
	This role ensures that all maintenance activities are documented, tracked, and reported efficiently through digital tools including the ticketing system, diesel remote monitoring, and online history  cards.
	The role also supports ISO audit readiness, asset tracking, stafftraining, and ensures continuous improvement in maintenance operations through organized data-driven practices.


Key Responsibilities


	Ticketing Services Management: Organize and track maintenance service requests using a ticketing system, ensuring timely resolution and proper documentation.
	Report Writing & Review: Review maintenance reports for accuracy and completeness; draft clear, concise, and actionable reports.
	Departmental Organization: Improve the quality and structure of maintenance reports and records, emphasizing prioritization and follow-up.
	Issue Analysis & Categorization: Identify recurring maintenance issues and determine root causes (human error, wear and tear, or equipment malfunction).
	Item Tagging & Tracking: Implement a system for tracking maintenance tasks, ensuring all equipment and assets are properly identified and monitored.
	Prioritization & Coordination: Prioritize maintenance tasks based on urgency and impact on operations.
	Communication & Follow-Up: Ensure effective communication between the maintenance team and other departments, providing regular updates on task progress.
	Quality Improvement: Identify and implement best practices to enhance the quality and efficiency of maintenance operations


Qualifications & Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree or HND in Engineering, Business Administration, Facility Management, 
	or related field.
	Proven experience in maintenance or administrative roles, with knowledge of ticketing systems, reporting, and process management.
	Knowledge of Basic Navision is highly required. 
	Experience in QSR, retail, or FMCG industry is an added advantage.
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	Excellent organizational skills and ability to prioritize tasks effectively.
	Ability to analyze data and recognize patterns in recurring maintenance issues.
	Familiarity with maintenance procedures, systems, and equipment.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, etc.).


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Commissary Supervisor

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Job Type: Full Time

Job Description


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Commissary Supervisor to oversee the daily production of pastries in our commissary.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for supervising production activities, ensuring product quality and consistency, managing inventory, maintaining hygiene standards, and coordinating with relevant departments to meet daily and weekly production targets.


Qualifications


	Coordinate with the Head Chef/Production Manager on production schedules and output targets.
	Ensure compliance with food safety, hygiene, and sanitation standards at all times.
	Monitor inventory levels of raw materials and finished goods and communicate timely restocking needs.
	Assign duties to production staff and ensure optimal use of manpower and resources.
	Conduct routine checks to ensure adherence to recipe specifications and portion controls.
	Train and mentor pastry team members to improve technical skills and maintain high standards.
	 Maintain accurate records of production output, waste, and ingredient usage.
	Collaborate with procurement, logistics, and store teams to ensure timely delivery and distribution of products.
	 Report equipment malfunctions or maintenance needs to the appropriate department.
	Enforce discipline, timekeeping, and safety protocols within the commissary team.


Reports:


	Daily Production & Dispatch Report – Summarizes quantities of pastries produced and dispatched to various outlets.
	Raw Material Usage & Wastage Report – Tracks ingredient consumption against recipes and highlights any wastage.
	Inventory Stock Count & Reconciliation Report – Provides weekly/monthly physical stock checks and system alignment.
	Quality Control & Hygiene Compliance Report – Documents inspection results on product quality, cleanliness, and food safety.
	Equipment & Maintenance Log Report – Records machine performance, breakdowns, and maintenance activities


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Food Science, Culinary Arts, Business Administration, or a related field is an advantage.
	Minimum of 2 years of hands-on baking experience in a professional or high-volume production setting.
	At least 2-3 years of experience in commissary, kitchen, or production management.
	Strong knowledge of pastry and bakery operations, including recipe execution, portion control, and inventory handling.
	Proven leadership and team management skills.
	 Sound knowledge of food safety standards (e.g., HACCP) and kitchen hygiene practices.
	Excellent organizational and time management abilities.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-demand environment.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Production Supervisor

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description


	Measuring, Mixing and feeding batches of raw materials into production machinery
	Managing the Quality control measure in the area
	Submitting the production report and tracking measures of operations
	Operating production line equipment, like a Mixer, Rounder and divider line in a canning factory
	Assembling goods on a production line, like Rounding dough etc…
	Reporting equipment faults to maintenance staff
	Finishing products, for example applying protective coatings
	Monitoring the production process and carrying out basic testing and quality checks
	Storing goods and raw materials in the factory or warehouse
	Managing daily buffer
	OER Action Plan
	ISO Action Plan
	Internal Audit plan
	Cleaning and maintaining work arears and machinery
	Daily check list and documentation


Qualifications


	Bachelors Degree in Management, Statistics or Business
	3 years of experience in related field.
	Proven experience as Production Supervisor or similar role will be an added advantage
	Ability to work a flexible schedule based on business needs, which may include evenings, weekends and holidays
	Demonstrated self-starter and problem solver with excellent interpersonal skills
	Able to work under pressure and tight deadlines and at the same time deliver time results and reports.
	Team player and fast worker
	High Integrity, utmost confidentiality level
	Good analytical skills
	Excellent Excel skill
	Detail-oriented
	Problem-solving and critical thinking skills.


Additional Information:


	Good Practical Skills
	The ability to work quickly and methodically
	The ability to concentrate while doing repeted tasks
	The ability to follow instrauctions
	Only qualified candidates will be contacted.


Click here to apply online    

    

        Click here to Apply

Social Media Manager Job at Wahala No Dey Finish




        
    

        
        Wahala No Dey Finish - Come Chop is a food content brand that focuses on creating engaging video content and high-quality visuals. They are active on platforms like YouTube and Facebook, showcasing food-related challenges and culinary showdowns, aiming to build an active and positive online community around their unique brand identity in the food content industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
Platform Management and Community Engagement:
     

            
    




	Actively foster an engaged and positive online community, encouraging discussions and user-generated content.
	Monitor social media channels for trends, feedback, and opportunities for engagement.
	Content Strategy and Calendar Planning
	Performance Analysis and Reporting.


Qualifications and Skills


	Experience as a Social Media Manager or similar role, with a strong track record of managing and growing social media platforms.
	Passion for food content and a desire to contribute to a growing brand.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio to: contactwahalanodeyfinish@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

General Manager, Farming (with experience in Agronomy) Job at Agbeyewa Farms




        
    

        
        Agbeyewa Farms is a world-class agribusiness with farm operations in Ekiti State, Nigeria. We have foresight for expansion into Africa whilst we create decent jobs and economic opportunities for local communities and become a force to reckon with in the agribusiness on a global scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager, Farming (with experience in Agronomy)
Job Location: Ekiti

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a talented professional who is passionate about socio-economic development through agricultural and Agro-allied investments.
	Day-to-day management of cultivation and equipment.
	Supervising department heads.
	Manage the farm's finances
	Ensure compliance with regulations,
	Implement sustainable farming techniques and modern agricultural technologies
	Collaborate with R&D to improve crop yields.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Agriculture (Master's preferred) and a minimum of 10 years of progressive leadership experience in commercial farming, with at least five years in a general management position.
	A proven track record of managing large-scale farms (over 500 hectares),
	Strong business skills including budgeting and strategic planning, and knowledge of modern agricultural practices and technology.
	Excellent leadership and communication skills.
	Familiarity with Nigerian and West African agricultural policies, climates, and challenges.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: talent@agbeyewa.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
